definition: peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
main hall/front courtyard/law court
to resist/to fight/to defy/anti-
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: The Equus will try to go up against the Mercedes S-class and the Lexus LS.
sentences.chinese: 雅科仕将尝试与奔驰S级和雷克萨斯LS分庭抗礼。

definition: to be on an equal footing
contend against
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to behave informally as equals/not to stand on ceremony
to strive
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song)/(coll.) to challenge
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
equally matched/about the same
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
to contend for supremacy
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
